timeline.author: abbccdda

timeline.bodyText: Below, we have a case where we throw the underlying exception if we run out of retries. Is that intentional?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I was debating changing that one too. If retries are exhausted, do we consider that a timeout? I guess it's defensible.
replies.author: hachikuji

replies.bodyText: Right, if retries are exhausted and it's a retriable exception, then it seems like it should be a TimeoutException.
replies.author: ijuma

timeline.message: Use TimeoutException when retries are exhausted
